authorLine.description:
For example:
  - Ian T Baldwin
  - Randy Schekman, Mark Patterson
  - Lee R Berger et al

statusDate.description: Date/time the `status` changed to this value (eg article moved from PoA to VoR).

equalContributionGroups.title: Equal contribution group IDs
equalContributionGroups.description:
Authors that contribute equally are linked together through a generated ID.

IDs will only be included if it is shared between two or more authors.

items.title: Phone number
items.description:
Phone number in E.164 format.

For example:
  - +447700900415
  - +12025550182;ext=555

deceased.description: Whether the person was deceased when the article was published.

authorLine.description:
For example:
  - Ian T Baldwin
  - Randy Schekman, Mark Patterson
  - Lee R Berger et al

date.title: Partial date
date.description:
A date, where the month and/or day may not be known/available.

For example:
  - 2016
  - 2016-09
  - 2016-09-16

preferred.title: Preferred name
preferred.description:
This is generally the name that is used by the person for English-language publications.

For example:
  - Randy Schekman
  - K. VijayRaghavan
  - Li Wenhui

index.title: Index name
index.description:
This is the name that should be used for indexing people.

For example:
  - Schekman, Randy
  - VijayRaghavan, Krishnaswamy
  - Li Wenhui

first.title: First page
first.description:
Page number on which the work starts.

For example:
  - 8
  - D760
  - xii

last.title: Last page
last.description:
Page number on which the work ends. If the work is only on one page, this will be the same as `first`.

For example:
  - 8
  - D714
  - xiii

range.title: Page ranges
range.description:
Complete page range information for the work. Contains one or more comma-seperated page ranges.

`first` contains the first value, `last` the final value.

For example:
  - 8
  - D706D714
  - 811, 1419, 40

oneOf.title: eLocation ID
oneOf.description: Bibliographic identifier for a document that does not have traditional printed page numbers.
